guide.title: KDE Stable Team
guide.abstract: The objective of the kde-stable subproject is to test KDE releases and release candidates thoroughly before stabilization.

body.p: Currently, most KDE team members run unstable versions of KDE, leading to only basic testing being conducted on KDE packages by arch testers during stabilization. This subproject remedies that lack of testing by creating a specific group of testers, comprised of both developers and non-developers, who will run a stabilization candidate version of KDE and test it thoroughly before the stabilization process begins.

In addition to the warm, fuzzy feeling inside that comes from contributing to Gentoo, members of kde-stable will be given +v (auto-voice) in #gentoo-kde. Additionally, if members wish to contribute directly to the KDE team overlay, participating and contributing to the kde-stable project can help demonstrate trustworthiness to KDE team members.

Members of the subproject will be directed to start testing a particular KDE version when a bug is filed in preparation for stabilization, and to use that version in a normal day-to-day manner in order to find bugs.
Members of the kde-stable team do not need to be developers, but they need to use KDE on a routine basis and run a stable environment with only the requested KDE version keyworded as testing.
Currently under discussion; those interested in joining should contact ago or creffett. Subject to change in the future.
Members should be testing KDE 4.9.1 at present.
